option.p: Normal usage (see below for special cases):

dl.dd: Options to control and guide the analysis.
The name of the executable target program file to be analysed for bounds on execution time and/or stack usage.
The names of one or more "root" subprograms to be analysed. All subprograms that are called from the root subprograms are usually also analysed.

option.p: When the option is used, the root-subprogram names can be omitted. The command line takes a different form when "HRT mode" is selected by the option or when the option is used. To learn more about these cases, run Bound-T with the arguments "-help dump", "-help hrt", or "-help help", respectively.
To learn more about Bound-T options in general, run Bound-T with the arguments "-help options".
